button.caption: Change Length
button.tooltip:
Extend or Trim the line to the specified length.
Trim: A positive value less than the line length measures the new length from the first vertex. A negative value less than the line length trims the specified length from the last vertex.
Extend: A positive value greater than the line length measures the new length from the first vertex. A negative value greater than than the line length measures the new length from the last vertex

button.tooltip: Only show records that fall within the current map extent.The map must be 2D in order to filter the table by extent.

button.caption: Statistics
button.tooltip: Generate a report of statistics for the selected values in this numeric field. If any of the rows in the table are currently selected, statistics will only be generated for the selected rows.Disabled if the field is not numeric.

button.caption: Calculate Field
button.extendedCaption: Calculate field values within a table.
button.tooltip: Set the values of this field by specifying a calculation expression. If any of the rows in the table are currently selected, only the values of the selected rows will be calculated.The project has unsaved edits, there is no field selected, or the table is read only.

button.caption: Calculate Geometry
button.extendedCaption: Calculate geometry values within a table.
button.tooltip: Set the values of this field by specifying a geometry property of the features, such as x-coordinate, y-coordinate, length, area, or number of vertices. If any of the rows in the table are currently selected, only the values of the selected rows will be calculated.This table or field does not support Calculate Geometry.

button.caption: Summarize
button.tooltip: Create a summary table grouped by the values in the current field. If any of the rows in the table are currently selected, only the values of the selected rows will be calculated.

button.caption: Delete
button.extendedCaption: Delete a field from a table.
button.tooltip: Delete selected field(s) from this table.The project has unsaved edits, the field is required, or the table or its schema is read-only.

button.caption: Hide Field
button.tooltip: Turn selected field(s) off to not show here or in any other dialog.

button.caption: Freeze/Unfreeze Field
button.tooltip: Keep selected field(s) visible when scrolling the table left or right.

button.caption: Add Join
button.tooltip: Join data to this layer or standalone table based on a common attribute.Joins are not available for subtype layers.

button.caption: Remove Join
button.tooltip: Remove joined data from the current table.

button.caption: Remove All Joins
button.tooltip: Remove all joined data from the current table.

button.caption: Add Relate
button.tooltip: Relate data to this layer or standalone table based on a common attribute. Unlike a join, a relate does not append data to the layer or standalone table.Relates are not available for non-OID tables or subtype layers.

button.caption: Remove Relate
button.tooltip: Remove the relate from the current table.

button.caption: Remove All Relates
button.tooltip: Remove all relates from the current table.

button.caption: Zoom To
button.extendedCaption: Zoom map to selected features within table.
button.tooltip: Zoom in and center the map on the extent of the features in the selected rows.Make sure there are features selected. If that does not work, try clicking the map to initialize it before zooming.

button.caption: Zoom To
button.extendedCaption: Zoom to the feature in the current row within table.
button.tooltip: Zoom in and center the map on the feature in the current row.Must have an initialized map view. Click the map view to initialize it.

button.caption: Pan To
button.extendedCaption: Pan map to selected features within table.
button.tooltip: Center the map around the features in the selected rows.Make sure there are features selected. If that does not work, try clicking the map to initialize it before zooming.

button.caption: Pan To
button.extendedCaption: Pan to feature in the current row within table.
button.tooltip: Pan the map to the feature in the current row.Must have an initialized map view. Click the map view to initialize it.

button.caption: Flash
button.extendedCaption: Flash in map the feature in the current row within table
button.tooltip: Flash the shape of the feature in the map.Must have an initialized map view. Click the map view to initialize it.

button.caption: Manage Attachments
button.extendedCaption: Open Attachments manager for the current row in the table.
button.tooltip: Open Attachments Manager.

button.tooltip: Select all rows.

button.tooltip: Deselect all the currently selected rows.

button.tooltip: View focused information about the contents of layers within a configurable pinned pop-up window.

button.caption: Default Sort Order

button.tooltip: Reset sorting of the results to the default order defined by the locator - by score for an individual locator; and by the order of the participating locators listed in a composite locator and then by score.

button.caption: Export Features
button.tooltip: Convert a shapefile or geodatabase feature class to a shapefile or geodatabase feature class.The selected item is not a feature layer or this layer item does not support the export data capability.

button.caption: Export Table
button.tooltip: Export current table to new table.This layer or standalone table item does not support the export data capability.

button.tooltip: Select features by their attribute values.

button.caption: Copy
button.tooltip: Copy the selected cell's value to the clipboard.

button.caption: Paste
button.tooltip: Paste cell values from the clipboard.

button.tooltip: Find or replace particular values in this table.

button.caption: Find Next
button.tooltip: Find the next value in the table.

button.caption: Find Previous
button.tooltip: Find the previous value in the table.

button.caption: Go To
button.tooltip: Navigate to a specific row number in this table.

button.caption: Reconcile
button.extendedCaption: Reconcile the selected layer, table or datasource's version against an ancestor version.
button.tooltip: Reconcile the versions.You must be connected to a child version.

button.caption: Post
button.extendedCaption: Post the reconciled changes of the selected layer, table or datasource's version to the reconcile target version.
button.tooltip: Post the versions.Post the versions once all versions are reconciled.

button.caption: Conflict Manager
button.extendedCaption: View conflicts present after reconciling for the selected layer, table or datasource's version.
button.tooltip: View conflicts.No conflicts.

button.caption: Version Changes
button.extendedCaption: View changes between the current version and a target version for the selected layer, table or datasource's version.
button.tooltip: View changes.You must be connected to a child version.

button.caption: Refresh
button.extendedCaption: Refresh the version of the selected layer, table or datasource.
button.tooltip: Refresh the layers in the map for the current selection.Refresh disabled.

button.caption: Error Inspector
button.tooltip: Show the Error Inspector. This enables you to find, sort and fix geodatabase topology errors.

button.caption: Error Inspector
button.tooltip: Show the Error Inspector. This enables you to find, sort and fix parcel fabric errors.

button.caption: Error Inspector
button.tooltip: Show the Error Inspector. This enables you to find, sort and fix geodatabase validation errors.

button.caption: Error Inspector
button.tooltip: Show the Error Inspector. This enables you to find, sort and fix utility network errors.

button.caption: Validate All
button.tooltip: Identify topology errors and symbolize them on layers in the current map.This tool is not available in 3D views.

button.caption: Validate Extent
button.tooltip: Identify topology errors and symbolize them on layers in the current map extent.This tool is not available in 3D views.

tool.caption: Validate Specified Extent
tool.tooltip: Identify topology errors and symbolize them on layers in a specified map extent.This tool is not available in 3D views.

button.caption: Error Inspector
button.tooltip: Show the Error Inspector. This enables you to find, sort and fix errors.

button.tooltip: View focused information about the error feature in the current row within a configurable pop-up window.This function is not yet implemented.

button.tooltip: Switch selected rows.

button.tooltip: Deselect all the currently selected rows.

button.caption: Zoom To
button.extendedCaption: Zoom map to selected errors within table.
button.tooltip: Zoom in and center the map on the extent of the errors in the selected rows.Make sure there are error features selected. If that does not work, try clicking the map to initialize it before zooming.

button.caption: Mark As Exception
button.tooltip: Mark the selected errors as exceptions.

button.caption: Clear Exception
button.tooltip: Mark the selected errors as errors.

button.caption: Validate Extent
button.tooltip: Identify topology errors and symbolize them on layers in the current map extent.

button.caption: Features
button.tooltip: Select the features that created the errors in the selected rows.

button.caption: Map Extent
button.tooltip: Show errors in the current map extent.

button.caption: Show Status
button.tooltip: Show error life cycle information. Available with ArcGIS Data Reviewer License.

button.caption: Rules
button.tooltip: Enable filtering for topology rules.

button.caption: Rule Description
button.tooltip: View a description and an example graphic of the rule violated by this error.

button.caption: Remove Overlap
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Remove Overlap Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Remove the overlapping portion of the feature that is causing the error.

button.caption: Remove Segment
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Remove Segment Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Remove the segment of the line feature that is causing the error. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Create Feature
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Create Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Create a new feature from the error shape. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Merge
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB TopologyMerge Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Merge the overlap into one feature and remove it from the others. Choose which feature receives the overlapping portion on the dialog box that appears. This fix can be applied to one error only.

button.caption: Merge to Largest
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Merge to Largest Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Merge the shortest line into the longest line, retaining the attributes of the longest line feature. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Delete Feature
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Delete Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Delete the feature causing the topology error. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Split
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Split Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Split the features where they intersect. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Extend
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Extend Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Extend the line to snap to the nearest line feature within the specified distance. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Trim
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Trim Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Trim the line to the nearest intersecting line feature within the specified distance. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Snap
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Snap Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Snap the dangling line feature to the nearest line within the specified tolerance. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Simplify
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Simplify Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Remove self-overlapping or self-intersecting line segments from the feature causing the error. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.Coming Soon

button.caption: Explode
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Explode Feature Fix Method
button.tooltip: Create a separate feature for each part of the multipart feature. This fix can be applied to one or more errors.

button.caption: Build
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Build Fix Method
button.tooltip: Build the parcel.

button.caption: Assign To Active Record
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Assign To Active Record Fix Method
button.tooltip: Assign to active record.

button.caption: No Fix Available
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology No Fix Method
button.tooltip: A predefined topology solution is not available. Use other tools to fix the error.

button.caption: Mark as Exception
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Mark as Exception Method
button.tooltip: Mark an error as an exception.

button.caption: Clear Exception
button.extendedCaption: Editing GDB Topology Mark as Error Method
button.tooltip: Clear the exception.

button.tooltip: View a description and an example graphic of the rule violated by this error.

button.caption: Distribute Vertically
button.tooltip: Distribute the selected features so that there is an equal amount of space between their edges.

button.caption: Distribute Horizontal Centers
button.tooltip: Space the center points of the selected features equally in the horizontal direction. The two outside features remain stationary.

button.caption: Distribute Vertical Centers
button.tooltip: Space the center points of the selected features equally in the vertical direction. The two outside features remain stationary.

button.caption: Cancel
button.tooltip: Cancel origin and rotation changes.

button.caption: Show Only Active
button.tooltip: Click to show only parcels in the active record. Show Only Active can be toggled on or off. If Show Only Active is toggled off, you can set the transparency of parcels that are not part of the active record.Available only when an active record is set.

button.caption: Show Only Active On
button.tooltip: Click to show only parcels in the active record. If Show Only Active is toggled off, you can set the transparency of parcels that are not part of the active record.Available only when an active record is set.

button.caption: Show Only Active Off
button.tooltip: Click to stop showing only parcels in the active record. If Show Only Active is toggled off, you can set the transparency of parcels that are not part of the active record.Available only when an active record is set.

button.caption: Manage
button.tooltip: Search for records by typing a record name or using a search query.

customControl.caption: Active Record
customControl.tooltip: Click to toggle the active record on or off. If you are doing a record-driven workflow, toggle the active record on and choose the record to set as active. New parcels are added to the active record.

button.caption: Align Parcels
button.tooltip: Show the Align Parcels pane. This allows you to make adjacent parcels coincident using an alignment tolerance and links.

tool.caption: Delete Links And Anchor Points
tool.tooltip: Deletes Alignment Links And Anchor Points.

tool.caption: Show
tool.tooltip: Click to display the alignment tolerance buffer. The display of the alignment tolerance buffer can be toggled on or off.

customControl.caption: Enter Alignment Value
customControl.tooltip: Enter a search buffer value that's used to find features to align.

button.caption: Switch
button.tooltip: Switch parcel selection.Available only when there are selected parcels or parcel lines.

button.caption: Align Features
button.tooltip: Align Features closes gaps between adjacent polyline or polygon features using a traced line and a buffer tolerance.

button.caption: Highlight
button.tooltip: Highlight gaps and overlaps in the current extent.

button.caption: Clear
button.tooltip: Clear highlight.

tool.caption: Select Parcels
tool.tooltip: Select one or more parcels.

button.caption: Consistency Check
button.extendedCaption: Analyzes the parcel fabric measurement network by running a least-squares adjustment on the input parcels.
button.tooltip: Analyzes the parcel fabric measurement network by running a least-squares adjustment on the input parcels. A free-network least-squares adjustment checks dimensions on parcel lines for inconsistencies and mistakes. Fixed or weighted control points are not used by the adjustment.

button.caption: Weighted
button.extendedCaption: Analyzes the parcel fabric measurement network by running a least-squares adjustment on the input parcels.
button.tooltip: Analyzes the parcel fabric measurement network by running a least-squares adjustment on the input parcels. A weighted least-squares adjustment computes updated coordinates for parcel points. The parcels being adjusted should connect to at least two fixed or weighted control points.

button.caption: Apply
button.extendedCaption: Applies the results of a least squares adjustment to parcel fabric feature classes.
button.tooltip: Applies the results of a least squares adjustment to parcel fabric feature classes.

button.caption: Switch Gallery Size

button.tooltip: Add groups, reorder, or remove the tools in the Tool gallery.

button.tooltip: Click to toggle the active record on or off. If you are doing a record-driven workflow, toggle the active record on and choose the record to set as active. New parcels are added to the active record.More than one record is selected. Select only one record.

button.tooltip: Assign the selected parcel features to the selected record.No parcel features are selected or more than one record is selected. Select at least one parcel feature and only one record.

button.tooltip: Pan the map to the active record.Available only when there is an active record set.
